name: Champel Capital Overview
overview:
Champel Capital is a venture capital firm. With a spirit of entrepreneurship, it looks first and foremost at the vision leading the entrepreneur. Champel Capital believes that it should be investing in people, first and foremost. It strives to invest in companies led by entrepreneurs capable of envisioning and growing great companies with products and/or services meeting real market needs in large and growing markets.

The firm seeks companies with profound deep tech creating durable barriers to entry by the competition, thus gaining a sustainable hedge for the long-term and making a real impact on the world. It is less interested in companies whose products and/or services may become a commodity in short order.

The firm's clients enjoy a wealth of flexibility. Investing in Champel Capital Impact Deep Tech Fund grants the diversification and professional management of their capital in the Israeli VC space. Alternatively, its clients can opt to invest directly in specific companies through Champel Capital L.P.s SPVs, with the luxury to pick and choose a precise investment. With this system, its LPs fully maintain their power of decision on every single deal, both in terms of ticket size and whether to add money on each subsequent round.
locations: Kharlap Street 41, Jerusalem, Israel
industries: Agriculture & Food Technologies, Health Tech & Life Sciences, Automotive & Mobility Technologies, Industrial Technologies, Energy Tech, Aerospace, Defense & HLS

name: Coatue Overview
overview: Coutue is an investment platform that invests in ventures in early to growth stage. It has over 20 years of experience, 27 countries represented in their portfolio and over 40 exits.
locations: San Francisco, CA, USA, 4th Floor, 1-2 Warwick St, London W1B 5LR, UK, 100 Wilshire Blvd 16th Floor, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA, 9 W 57th St, New York, NY 10019, USA, 8 Finance St, Central, Hong Kong
industries: Fintech & Insurtech, Cyber Security, Business Software

name: Boldstart Ventures Overview
overview:
Boldstart Ventures is a day one partner and true believer for enterprise infrastructure and SaaS founders. Boldstart is often the first investor working closely with technical founders at company formation and helps accelerate their path to product-market fit. The firm's areas of focus include developer first, cloud infrastructure, cybersecurity, and SaaS.

Boldstart has backed over 60 enterprise startups like BigID, Security Scorecard, snyk.io, kustomer, divide (sold to Google), goinstant (sold to salesforce), blaze.io (sold to Akamai), and rapportive (sold to LinkedIn).
locations: 30 East 23rd Street, New York, NY, USA, 3350 Virginia St, Miami, FL, USA
industries: Cyber Security, Business Software, Fintech & Insurtech, Media & Entertainment Technologies

name: FinTLV Ventures Overview
overview:
FinTLV is a global insurtech-focused fund with $500m AUM.

It partners with insurtech companies through all phases, with a bias towards later-stage deals. Its recent investments include leading or participating in investment rounds in some of the most prestigious companies in these fields, including Hippo Insurance, Next Insurance, Unqork, Corvus, Wefox, and many others.

The firm works closely with management teams and leverages its broad global network of insurance, re-insurance and insurtech companies to support its portfolio companies.

The funds limited partners include some of the worlds leading insurance companies.
locations: Shoken Street 13, Tel Aviv-Yafo, Israel
industries: Fintech & Insurtech, Aerospace, Defense & HLS, Health Tech & Life Sciences, Business Software, Automotive & Mobility Technologies

name: Battery Ventures Overview
overview:
Battery Ventures is a technology-focused global investment firm pursuing promising companies and ideas. It invests in potentially cutting-edge, category-defining businesses in markets including application software, IT infrastructure, consumer internet and mobile services, and industrial technologies.

Battery Ventures' private equity practice focuses on helping technology companies in the U.S., Europe and Israel grow organically and through acquisitions. Battery Ventures work primarily with businesses in the information-technology and industrial-technology sectors and partner with teams to accelerate growth, tap new markets, re-orient existing businesses and build platforms through acquisitions.

Founded in 1983, Battery Ventures backs companies at stages ranging from seed to growth and private equity and invests globally from offices in Boston, Silicon Valley, New York, London, and Israel.
investment_stages: Early stage, Growth Stage, Late stage
locations: Arania Osvaldo St 17, Tel Aviv-Yafo, Israel, 3 Cavendish Square, London, UK, Boston, MA, USA, 260 Townsend Street, San Francisco, CA, USA, 636 6th Ave suite 440, New York, NY 10011, USA, 2882 Sand Hill Road, Menlo Park, CA, USA

name: Corundum Neuroscience Overview
overview:
Corundum Neuroscience is a venture builder and fund advancing transformative neuroscience solutions from lab-to-life. The CNS team combines deep domain expertise with a track-record of venture-building success to accelerate neuroscience solutions across the entire innovation lifecycle. Taking a long-term investment approach, Corundum Neuroscience helps researchers, entrepreneurs and startups develop life-changing solutions that target specific disease areas and outcomes to enhance people's health, longevity and happiness.
Corundum Neuroscience operates under parent company Corundum Innovation, a Japanese-based investment firm providing comprehensive support through research funding, venture investment services and new business consulting.
investment_stages: Early stage, Growth Stage, Late stage
locations: Ha-Menofim Street 11, Herzliya, Israel
industries: Health Tech & Life Sciences, Media & Entertainment Technologies

name: Angular Ventures Overview
overview: Angular Ventures is a specialist, early-stage venture capital firm based in Tel Aviv and London that invests in enterprise technology companies from Israel or Europe.

name: Aristagora VC Overview
overview: Aristagora VC is a sector-agnostic early-stage venture capital fund. We partner with exceptional teams and support them from inception to growth. We believe in a " hands-on” approach and work closely with our portfolio companies to add value in any aspect required. We offer our expertise and deep network in Japan to provide our companies with access to the Japanese market.

name: Dell Technologies Capital Overview
overview:
Dell Technologies Capital (DTC) is Michael Dell's early-stage VC. It's a $1.7B fund that invests in determined early-stage founders who push the envelope on technology innovation for the enterprise, connecting them to the capital, expertise, and customers they need to take a company from start to scale. DTC typically leads Seed and Series A investment rounds.

Since its inception in 2012, it has backed more than 170 startups, a list that notably includes VAST Data, Arista Networks, Cylance, DocuSign, Exotec, JFrog, MongoDB, Nasuni, Netskope, Nutanix, Nuvia, Redis, Xometry, and Zscaler. Core investment areas include cybersecurity, AI/ML, edge & logistics, data & analytics, developer tools, infrastructure, silicon and B2B applications.

DTC has offices in Palo Alto (HQ), Boston, and Tel Aviv.
locations: Derech Menachem Begin 121, Tel Aviv-Yafo, Israel, Palo Alto, CA, USA
industries: Business Software, Cyber Security, Health Tech & Life Sciences, Industrial Technologies, Other, Automotive & Mobility Technologies

name: Cerca Partners Overview
overview:
Cerca Partners is a co-investment VC fund with a sustainable advantage of unique insights and access to the best Israeli startup investment opportunities.

The firm invests alongside top-tier VC funds in the most promising Israeli tech startups. It is powered by a community and network of global tech entrepreneurs and top Venture Capital Funds.

The firm has identified and invested in multiple category leaders in various verticals including fintech, cybersecurity, automotive, and more.

name: Arkin Digital Health Overview
overview: Arkin Digital Health is the early-stage digital health investment arm of Arkin Capital, a multi-billion-dollar global investment group. It backs B2B and B2B2C healthcare IT, tech-enabled services, and pharma-tech startups addressing unmet business needs in the U.S. market. Leveraging Arkin’s broad expertise across pharma, biotech, devices, and digital health, the fund offers its portfolio access to capital, networks, and market insight, supported by a U.S.–Israel advisory board.
locations: Ha-Menofim St 11, Herzliya, 4672562, Israel

name: CyberStarts Overview
overview:
Cyberstarts is a venture capital firm focused on cyber security and mostly backed by cyber entrepreneurs. Cyberstarts' vision is to become the leading platform for amazing teams of entrepreneurs solving the next big problems of the cyber security world. Cyberstarts leverages its collective experience and networks to partner with entrepreneurs solving critical pain points in cyber security and building important cyber security companies of the next 10 years.

The fund has also partnered with a US-based group of chief information security officers who work closely with the firm to identify and rank pain points that will need to be solved in the near future. The fund's CISOs and market experts are ready to help the companies figure out productmarket fit, go-to-market, pricing, procurement considerations, and more.
locations: HaMafteah Street 5, Mikhmoret, Israel, Illinois, USA
industries: Cyber Security, Fintech & Insurtech

name: Awz Ventures Overview
overview:
Awz Ventures is a Canadian hub for investment in cybersecurity, intelligence and physical security AI-based technologies from Israel, a global leader in these sectors.

Awz manages US $250M across its four venture capital funds, with seed through growth-stage investments in 18 innovative Israeli cybersecurity, intelligence and physical security AI-based technological companies.

Awz management and advisors include former senior executives from global security and intelligence agencies (Mossad, ISA, CIA, FBI, MI5, CSIS, CAF), and international business and venture capital experts.
locations: Derech Menachem Begin 121, Tel Aviv-Jaffa, Israel, 20 Eglinton Ave W, Toronto, ON M4R 1K8, Canada
industries: Cyber Security, Business Software, Health Tech & Life Sciences, Aerospace, Defense & HLS, Media & Entertainment Technologies, Automotive & Mobility Technologies, Industrial Technologies

name: Disruptive AI Overview
overview:
Disruptive AI (DAI) is an Israeli venture capital fund focused on early-stage startups in the broad field of Artificial Intelligence (AI). The fund brings together Disruptive ideas & remarkable AI technologies to transform markets.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) is at the heart of modern innovation, and Israel is at the heart of AI. DAI is looking for visionary entrepreneurs harnessing the power of AI and frontier technologies to transform markets and revolutionize industries.

name: AP Partners Overview
overview:
AP Partners is an Israel-based private equity fund backed by top notch institutional and high-net-worth families. AP Partners focuses on under the radar Israeli small & medium product-oriented enterprises with growth prospective.

The fund invests at the scale-up stage of companies with limited technological risk, transforming the companies into distinctive businesses with an international footprint. With a straight forward, down-to-earth approach, AP Partners works closely with its portfolio companies to unlock their potential, empower their management, and accelerate their growth.

The firm invests in proprietary, product-oriented, small and medium Israel based companies at the scale-up stage with limited technological risks. It looks to engage with companies focused on a growing niche in a fragmented industry, with a clear, differentiated competitive edge. AP Partners is an active and constructive investor, engaged with company management to leverage its industry knowledge, experience and resources to help accelerate the companys growth.

AP Partners take a long-term approach, and provide flexible financial structures of up to a few dozen million USD, driven by company objectives.
locations: Menachem Begin Road 144, Tel Aviv-Yafo, Israel

name: Benchmark Capital Overview
overview:
Benchmark Capital is a venture capital firm specializing in early-stage investments in technology-driven companies in the areas of enterprise software and services, communications and security, semiconductors, mobile computing, consumer services, and financial services.The firm seeks to invest primarily in companies based in the United States and Europe.

Benchmark Capital was founded in 1995 and is based in Menlo Park, California.

name: Flint Capital Overview
overview:
Flint Capital invests in promising entrepreneurs and technology ventures with global ambitions. Its global positioning enables it to support Israeli and European ventures on both sides of the ocean, as they expand into the US market. This "bridge" strategy, as well as its broad network of entrepreneurs, industry experts, and leading investment funds provides it with access to high-quality investment opportunities.

Flint Capital invests in tech market segments as: Enterprise Software, Cyber Security, Financial Technologies, Health Technologies, Artificial Intelligence, Automation, Consumer Mobile Applications, and Marketplaces.

name: Deep Insight Overview
overview:
Deep Insight is an Israeli venture fund investing only in Deep Tech at all stages and across all sectors, including semiconductors and any scientific or technological breakthrough in physics or life science. Deep Insight is a stage agnostic fund backed by few high-net-worth individuals. Its focus is on Israel-related ventures.


The fund is mainly reviewing investments in the following sectors (but not limited to): Life Sciences & HealthTech, Industrial Technologies, Space Tech, AgriFood Tech, Climate Tech, Energy tech, Quantum Computing and Semiconductors.

name: at.inc/ Overview
overview: at.inc/ is a seed-stage fund that leads rounds with conviction by partnering with startups at the earliest possible stage, sometimes as early as the idea phase. The firm dives in with founders from day one, supporting their mission with capital, guidance, strategic, and operational support continuously throughout the company's journey. Led by general partners Nadav Eylath and Roni Bonjack, at.inc/ combines a top 5 percent investment return track record with deep operational expertise in building and scaling startups.

name: BRM Group Overview
overview:
BRM Group is a dynamic venture capital fund investing in Israel-related software, internet infrastructure, and communications companies. Since 1988 BRM has built a reputation on creating and maintaining winwin relationships of uncompromising integrity with all of its business partners.
BRM harnesses the talent of committed team players who have been involved in some of the largest investments in Israeli high-tech, from CheckPoint in the 1980s to Passave in recent years. The group enjoys flexible, streamlined investment decision making and has the experience needed to comfortably invest in companies at all stages of growth, from seed and early-stage to late-stage companies. Working hand in hand with visionary entrepreneurs, BRM leverages its passion for growth to create the next generation of Israeli technology success stories.

name: Blue Capital Overview
overview: Blue Capital is a venture capital firm investing in dual‑use science and security technologies, with a particular focus on artificial intelligence, fusion, nuclear, and defense sectors. Founded by Matthew Chase Levy and based in San Francisco, the firm applies free‑market principles to support entrepreneurs building systems that address existential threats and enhance global security and scientific advancement
locations: 214 Diamond St #1753, San Francisco, CA 94114, USA

name: Artofin Overview
overview:
Artofin targets investments in the elite 1% of Israeli and Nordic technology companies, providing strategic guidance for their expansion into Asian markets.

With established networks across Thailand, Japan, Vietnam, Singapore, and beyond, Artofin specializes in deep tech innovations transforming critical industries - from smart cities and quantum computing to cybersecurity, sustainability solutions, and autonomous vehicle technology
locations: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Israel, Bangkok, Thailand

name: eHealth Ventures Overview
overview:
eHealth Ventures is a VC fund in Israel, focused on finding, funding, and growing promising early-stage Israeli digital-health companies. It works directly with one of the largest healthcare providers in Israel, Maccabi Healthcare, and its network of partners spans North America, Europe, and Asia.

eHealth Ventures has built a veteran team with expertise in healthcare, technology, start-ups, and investment capital, backed by a unique partnership of multinational healthcare leaders. This combination of resources positions it to help promising new companies with great ideas to flourish, while giving investors a highly leveraged opportunity to get involved in promising eHealth developments in an extremely innovative start-up ecosystem. Having reviewed over 1450 companies, eHealth Ventures has created a portfolio composed of 15 startup companies, all in the field of Digital Health.

eHealth Ventures has also an incubation program under the concession of the Israel Innovation Authority (IIA). As part of the incubator, the firm partnered with Maccabi Health Fund, Cleveland Clinic, eHealth Ventures, Amgen, Shanghai Creation, Shafa Invesco, and Medison Pharma.
locations: Prof. Yehezkel Kaufmann St. 2, Tel Aviv-Yafo, Israel, Chevy Chase, MD, USA
industries: Health Tech & Life Sciences

name: FLORA Ventures Overview
overview: FLORA Ventures is an early-stage VC firm dedicated to investing in purpose-led entrepreneurs transforming the $8T AgriFood and Sustainability industries. The firm focuses on Israeli and European startups poised for US market expansion, and aims to generate high return on investment and impact (ROI²) while adhering to its "Good for People, Kind to the Planet" manifesto.
locations: HaYarkon St 73, Tel Aviv-Yafo, Israel
industries: Health Tech & Life Sciences, Agriculture & Food Technologies

name: Extantia Capital Overview
overview: Extantia Capital is a climate-first venture capital firm accelerating the path to a decarbonised world. Extantia unites mission-driven entrepreneurs, scientists, investors, and business leaders to advance the transition. The platform includes Extantia Flagship, a fund backing scalable deep decarbonisation companies, Extantia Allstars, a fund-of-funds investing in climate venture capital funds, and Extantia Ignite, a sustainability hub advancing knowledge and competence in climate innovation and ESG practices.
locations: Zionskirchstraße 73a, 10119 Berlin, Germany
industries: Energy Tech

name: Canaan Partners Israel Overview
overview:
Canaan Partners Israel (CPI) is a venture capital fund focused on early-stage technology investments in Israel. Started by experienced entrepreneurs and investors, CPI is dedicated to working closely with founders to help them transform innovative ideas into global, successful companies.

CPI leverages the strengths of Canaan Partners global network and on-the-ground presence in New-York City and Silicon Valley, and CPIs close relationship with industry-leading multi-national technology players. It provides access to strategic partners, industry experts, top-tier customers and follow-on investors. The global fund is an early-stage venture capital firm that invests in entrepreneurs with visionary ideas with $5B under management.

CPI focuses its investments on three main sectors where it believes the Israeli entrepreneurs have a unique competitive advantage: Digital Media & Mobile, SaaS & Enterprise Solutions & Internet & Cloud Infrastructure.

CPI is leveraging Start-Up Stadium, an online start-up community in Israel. Start-Up Stadium is a place to promote thought leadership and knowledge transfer, enabling entrepreneurs to harness the power of the network to share their ideas, launch their applications and services, and get direct feedback from the wisdom of the crowd.
locations: Raul Wallenberg Street 20, Tel Aviv-Yafo, Israel, Silicon Valley, CA, USA, New York, NY, USA
industries: Media & Entertainment Technologies, Cyber Security, Automotive & Mobility Technologies, Business Software, Other, Agriculture & Food Technologies, Aerospace, Defense & HLS

name: Brilliance Ventures Overview
overview:
Brilliance Ventures is an Israel-based Venture Capital fund, focused on investments in Israeli growth tech companies, which are in turn utilized to facilitate their next round of equity financing.

BV identifies the leading Israeli tech companies and based upon a strategic selection process makes an investment, followed by a collaboration to achieve ultimate success in all forms of Investment Banking activity, including but not limited to M&A, Private Placements, Secondary Deals, IPOs and Fundraising from Asia. BV'S team brings to the table experience and investments, which ultimately result in successful collaborations, launching companies to new and unexpected levels.

Brilliance Ventures is part of Tel-Aviv Capital investment group, a leading financial advisory provider in the Israeli tech ecosystem.
locations: Jabotinsky 2, Ramat Gan, Israel, Yan'an East Road, Huangpu, Shanghai, China, Langyuan Vintage, Jianwai Street, Chaoyang, Beijing, China
industries: Fintech & Insurtech, Business Software, Retail Platforms, Industrial Technologies

name: FIMI Opportunity Funds Overview
overview:
FIMI Opportunity Funds is an Israeli private equity firm. Since its founding, FIMI has successfully completed 99 investments, executed over 66 exits, with total transaction value of more than $6 billion, and raised seven funds.

FIMI typically invests in mature Israeli and Israel-related companies that are mature, have significant revenue and run a profitable operation. It invests in companies with significant growth potential and tangible growth engines. FIMI seeks companies with a solid and highly motivated management team in place.

The key to FIMIs successful investment strategy is its smart diversification. Investments are spread across a wide range of sectors, including automotive, electronic components, metals, software, aviation, plastics, building materials, communications, water filtration, pharmaceuticals, alternative and solar energy, warehousing, and logistics. The firm also diversifies its portfolio geographically by investing in companies that have a significant global footprint or are leaders in the Israeli market.

FIMI's investors include commercial banks, insurance companies, provident and pension funds, college and university endowments, family offices, and high net worth individuals from the United States, Europe, the Far East, and Israel.
locations: Yigal Alon Street 94, Tel Aviv-Yafo, Israel
industries: Aerospace, Defense & HLS, Health Tech & Life Sciences, Industrial Technologies

name: Eclipse Ventures Overview
overview:
Eclipse Ventures helps entrepreneurs build companies to boldly transform the industries that define and propel economies.

Eclipse Ventures likes big, multi-faceted industries and it looks for founders who think at an unprecedented scale. The firm likes full-stack solutions because physical industries often need a combination of technologies to drive real change.

Eclipse Ventures lead investments, being active board members and hands-on partners. It helps and guides its founders on a variety of issues from operating best practices to fundraising strategy, and everything in between.

Eclipse Ventures' team members have dreamed, developed and delivered world-changing products. They have run global manufacturing companies, world-class automotive automation departments, built start-ups from small apartments, scaled consumer companies, and raised significant amounts of capital from early-stage through IPO. They share their perspectives and networks with their founders.

The firm has invested in many early-stage companies and has been integral to the formation of several companies in its portfolio.
investment_stages: Early stage, Growth Stage, Late stage
locations: 514 High Street, Palo Alto, California, USA, 594 Broadway #707, New York, NY 10012, USA
industries: Industrial Technologies, Business Software, Health Tech & Life Sciences, Cyber Security, Media & Entertainment Technologies, Other

name: Elron Ventures Overview
overview:
Elron Ventures is focusing on early-stage investing, where it leverages its expertise across an array of different industries and key strategic partnerships to provide capital and assistance to promising Israeli tech start-ups helping them achieve their goal of becoming true global leaders.

Elron Ventures' group of companies includes companies at various stages of development that are engaged in a variety of technology fields, mainly medical devices, cybersecurity, information technology (IT), and enterprise software

Elron Ventures' team is dedicated to attracting and supporting imaginative and focused entrepreneurs and startups with never-been-done-before ideas. Its group companies benefit from its combined technological, strategic, entrepreneurial & business expertise, broad networks, and wide attention span.

Elron Ventures has a proven track record of investments and M&As deals with some the worlds leading companies. For example, Microsoft, Palo Alto Networks, Rapid7 and more. In recent years, Elron Ventures has played a part in exits valued at a total of $1.6 billion and today it manages more than $300 million in assets.
investment_stages: Early stage, Growth Stage, Late stage
locations: Yigal Alon Street 114, Tel Aviv-Yafo, Israel
industries: Cyber Security, Health Tech & Life Sciences, Industrial Technologies, Fintech & Insurtech, Business Software, Agriculture & Food Technologies, Aerospace, Defense & HLS

name: Bain Capital Ventures Overview
overview:
Bain Capital Ventures is the venture capital division within Bain Capital, which has approximately $155 billion of assets under management worldwide. Bain Capital is an American private multi-asset alternative investment firm that specializes in private equity, venture capital, credit, public equity, impact investing, life sciences, and real estate. Bain Capital invests across a range of industry sectors and geographic regions.

Bain Capital Ventures focuses on founders passionate about transforming major industries, ranging from SaaS, infrastructure software and security to fintech and healthcare to commerce and consumer tech. Its investments range from $1 million of seed capital through $100 million of growth equity.

Bain Capital Ventures unique and differentiated platform empowers founders to grow their companies at all stages. This starts with a partnership that has deep domain expertise and extensive operating experience. Furthermore, the firm leverages the global platform of Bain Capital to help founders access networks, partners and customers that are pivotal on the path to scale.

name: Caesar Overview
overview: caesar. is a venture capital fund based in Munich, Germany. The firm's mission is to support outstanding founders in creating a better tomorrow through technology.

name: Blumberg Capital Overview
overview:
Blumberg Capital has invested in early and growth stage enterprise software companies in North America, Israel and Europe for more than 30 years. The firm nurtures B2B technology companies from Seed stage through their growth journey, as active board members and hands-on advisors. Blumberg Capital was among the first investors in industry leaders including Addepar, Braze, DoubleVerify, Finaro, Fundbox, HootSuite, Nutanix, Trulioo and Yotpo.

The firm's Innovation Council is an invitation-only group of CIOs, technology and operational leaders who are passionate about technology-driven innovation, connecting with peers and getting an inside look at startups that could transform their businesses and industries. Innovation Council members offer perspectives from different sectors and companies such as Fidelity, Google, Okta and P&G.

The team is strategically based in Miami, New York, San Francisco and Tel Aviv.

name: Earth & Beyond Ventures Overview
overview:
Earth & Beyond Ventures is an early stage VC fund focused on investing in DeepTech Innovations from concept to creation. The venture is committed to identifying, nurturing, and investing in groundbreaking startups and research projects that have the potential to build a better and more sustainable earth and beyond.

The fund is specialized in DeepTech sectors such as sensors, optics & photonics, quantum computing, advanced materials, nanotech, semiconductors, new space and new energy. It is supported by top-tier corporate and financial investors and partnered with the Israel Innovation Authority (IIA) to operate a DeepTech incubator.

name: DTCP Overview
overview:
DTCP is an investment management firm with $3 billion in assets under management and over 50 professionals. DTCP has offices in Hamburg, Frankfurt, Berlin, London, Luxembourg, San Francisco, and Tel Aviv.

DTCP Growth invests in leading companies with a focus on cloud-based enterprise software. The team has made over 30 investments in Europe, Israel, and the US, with notable investments including Aircall, Arctic Wolf Networks, Auth0 (acquired by OKTA), Guardicore (acquired by Akamai), Fastly (NYSE: FSLY), Cohere, LeanIX (acquired by SAP SE), Pipedrive (acquired by Vista Private Equity), and Signavio (acquired by SAP SE). For a full list of portfolio companies please refer to www.dtcp.capital/growth-equity

name: Consensus Business Group (CBG) Overview
overview:
Consensus Business Group (CBG) is a UK-based investment group, led by Mr. Vincent Tchenguiz, with investments of over $700M in Israeli technologies, funds, incubators, and other initiatives.

Experts in structuring unique and strategic financial models, the groups key areas of investments in Israel are in the healthtech, life science, planetech (climate change technologies), and HLS sectors. Its diversified portfolio has been meticulously built along the years as an elaborated platform for corporates, countries, and other public and private key players to engage with.

Consensus Business Group is also believed to be the largest owner and asset manager of residential freehold interests in the UK, representing in excess of 1% of the housing stock in England and 1.2% in Greater London.

name: Corner Ventures Overview
overview:
Corner is an opportunistic investor in innovative and disruptive technology companies across a broad range of sectors. Corner has decades of experience investing in, operating, and partnering with top-tier businesses.
Corner's international platform of investors and strategic partners provides companies with the foundation from which to launch rapid international expansion.

name: Firstime VC Overview
overview:
Firstime Ventures invests in companies that are building a sustainable & accessible future for all.

Firstime Ventures is investing in Israeli entrepreneurs that are software-focused, building scalable products with a clear business model.

The firm is looking for founders that are helping to solve the worlds most urgent challenges: from reaching net zero carbon goals which will help mitigate the climate crisis, to precision agriculture tools that will help us adapt our farming and food industry to our new climate to accessible digital health solutions that can help billions of patients.
locations: HaNehoshet Street 6, Tel Aviv-Yafo, Israel
industries: Business Software, Health Tech & Life Sciences, Media & Entertainment Technologies, Cyber Security, Industrial Technologies, Agriculture & Food Technologies, Aerospace, Defense & HLS, Other, Energy Tech, Education & Knowledge Technologies

name: Catalyst Overview
overview:
Catalyst is an Israeli private equity firm with more than $450 million in assets under management. Since its founding in 1999, Catalyst has successfully completed more than 25 investments, raised three funds and had +50 exits from associated partners.

The Catalyst Fund I was established in 1999 as a venture capital fund. The fund focused its investment strategy on maturing Israeli technology companies and had a diversified portfolio across sectors such as telecom, IT, medical devices, and biotechnology.

The Catalyst Fund II was established in 2006 as a private equity fund focused on later-stage investments. The fund mainly invested in Israeli public and private technology companies in telecom, IT, enterprise software security, media, and other sectors.

In 2014 the firm established its third private equity fund, the Catalyst CEL Fund. This Israeli-China fund invests in mid- to late-stage Israeli companies with proven innovation and global presence whose growth strategy is oriented toward activities in emerging markets, with a special focus on greater China. The Catalyst CEL Fund is jointly managed by Catalyst and China Everbright Limited, the Hong Konglisted subsidiary of China Everbright Group. It focuses on sectors such as agriculture, industrials, water, energy, and more.

In May 2023, Catalyst Fund announced the closing of the fourth fund – Catalyst IV, which manages assets of $150 million including co-investments and will make both primary investments and direct secondary transactions. Catalyst IV offers co-investment opportunities as an integral part of its strategy, providing LPs unique access to deal flow and the ability to become direct shareholders in portfolio companies. The new fund, which has already started deploying capital, focuses on mature companies that are category leaders in various technology sectors, including enterprise SaaS, cybersecurity, smart mobility, climate tech, energy, life sciences, and others.
locations: HaArba'a Street 28, Tel Aviv-Yafo, Israel, Av. das Nações Unidas - Várzea de Baixo, São Paulo - SP, 04730-090, Brazil, 16 Harcourt Road, Central, Hong Kong
industries: Health Tech & Life Sciences, Industrial Technologies, Automotive & Mobility Technologies, Aerospace, Defense & HLS, Education & Knowledge Technologies, Other, Cyber Security, Fintech & Insurtech, Energy Tech, Business Software

name: AnD Ventures Overview
overview:
AnD Ventures is an early-stage VC investing in extraordinary people & frontier technologies. Focused on data, AI and validated market fit by working hand in hand with its growth & corporate partners to accelerate its entrepreneurs, creating industry-leading companies.

The firm's unique deal flow pool derives from its direct & close access to worldwide leading corporations, corporate programs, global VCs, accelerators, incubators, angel investors, entrepreneurs, and academia, working in complete synergy with its proven deep insight research methodology.

AnD Ventures growth partners come from some of the biggest tech giants globally, continuously improving its ability to support is companies and provide them with the guidance, support and opportunities they require.

AnD Ventures accelerated venture model enables it to grow companies better and faster, building with them the right path to exit whether it's through corporate acquisitions or secondary investments.

AnD supports Pre-Seed ventures through its Studio model and Seed companies through its fund. Investments generally range from $100,000 - $200,000 for AnD’s studio investments and $1-3 million for fund investments.
locations: Sapir St 2, Herzliya, Israel, Tel Aviv-Yafo, Israel
industries: Business Software, Media & Entertainment Technologies, Cyber Security, Fintech & Insurtech, Aerospace, Defense & HLS

name: Fearless DTC Growth Fund Overview
overview: Fearless Capital is a direct-to-consumer (DTC) growth fund that invests in early-stage consumer brands, combining capital with hands-on operational support. The firm partners with founders to validate market demand, develop scalable growth strategies, and build sustainable, profitable businesses. Backed by operators with experience growing a $100M+ DTC brand, the fund focuses on execution and long-term value rather than high-valuation hype or passive investing.
locations: King George St 48, Tel Aviv-Yafo, Israel

name: Edge Medical Ventures Overview
overview:
Edge Medical Ventures is a medtech-focused venture studio and fund managed by industry veterans with extensive operational experience.
Edge Medical Ventures is a cutting-edge investment fund dedicated to the advancement of healthcare through strategic investments in high-impact medical device companies.
With a focused mission to identify and nurture innovative ventures that address significant unmet clinical with large market potential , the fund aims to benefit patients, physicians, and investors alike.
Managed by a seasoned team of medical device industry veterans, Edge Medical Ventures takes a hands-on approach, providing not only financial support but also invaluable guidance and expertise to the companies in its portfolio.
There Venture Studio, which is called EdgeLabs, is an early-stage fund capable of investing between $50K and $3M during the initial stages of a venture.
locations: Ariel Sharon Blvd 8, Or Yehuda, Israel, 222 Jersey City Blvd, Jersey City, NJ 07305, USA
industries: Health Tech & Life Sciences

name: Cardumen Capital Overview
overview:
Cardumen Capital is a global venture capital and asset management company with presence in Europe and Israel that invests in world-class founders who bring the future into the present.

With €250M in Assets Under Management, Cardumen Capital’s extensive portfolio encompasses tech companies and fund investments across three different strategies, with global coverage.

Cardumen Capital strives to be the most active investor for both entrepreneurs and investors. Its portfolio benefits from decades of experience in the world’s most important tech ecosystems, a culture of radical collaboration and absolute availability. Cardumen Capital is backed by world-leading institutional investors and corporations.
locations: Herzel 16, Tel Aviv-Yafo, Israel, C. de Velázquez, 100, Salamanca, 28006 Madrid, Spain
industries: Business Software, Media & Entertainment Technologies, Industrial Technologies, Fintech & Insurtech, Cyber Security, Other, Agriculture & Food Technologies

name: F2 Venture Capital Overview
overview:
F2 is an early stage VC firm that invests in cutting edge technology companies out of Israel. We are a team of investors, operators and engineers taking ventures from pre-seed to IPO over the last twenty years. With $500 million under management, F2 powers visionary founders on their bold missions to transform industries.

F2 also operates the Operator Platform, a pre-seed investment platform to back founders with guidance, network, and capital from day zero.
locations: HaArba'a St 28, Tel Aviv-Yafo, Israel

name: CRV Overview
overview:
CRV is investing in high-growth technology companies for half a century. The firm has backed nearly 400 startups, including foundational companies like Twitter, Zendesk, Amgen, Hubspot, Parametric Technologies, Yammer, EqualLogic and Sonus Networks. Half of the companies CRV has backed have gone public or been acquired. The firm focuses on enterprise, consumer and bioengineering.

CRV invests early as a lead investor. Its focus is on Series A, with an occasional Seed or Series B investment.

CRV has offices in Palo Alto, CA and Cambridge, MA.
investment_stages: Early stage, Growth Stage, Late stage
locations: 52 Zoe Street, San Francisco, CA, USA, 300 Hamilton Avenue, Palo Alto, CA, USA, 855 Boylston Street, Boston, MA, USA
industries: Cyber Security, Business Software, Other, Health Tech & Life Sciences, Aerospace, Defense & HLS

name: Benhamou Global Ventures Overview
overview: BGV is a cross-border VC platform with deep roots in Silicon Valley and an exclusive focus on global Enterprise 5.0 technology innovation. As a pioneer in human-centric enterprise AI, BGV invests in startups that seamlessly combine human ingenuity with intelligent machines to drive efficiency, scalability, and productivity gains. The partnership sources companies from innovation hubs around the world and deploys financial and human capital from seed stage to IPO. With offices in Menlo Park, Tel Aviv, Paris, and Bangalore, BGV has championed a cross-border venture investing model with a portfolio representing businesses in the US, Israel, Europe, and India.
investment_stages: Early stage, Growth Stage, Late stage
locations: Derech Menachem Begin 144, Tel Aviv-Yafo, Israel, Japan, Kyoto, Shimogyo Ward, 134, Byculla East, Byculla, Mumbai, Maharashtra, India, 4 Rue Jules Lefebvre, 75009 Paris, France, 1600 El Camino Real Suite 280, Menlo Park, CA 94025, USA
industries: Business Software, Cyber Security, Automotive & Mobility Technologies, Other, Energy Tech

name: Arieli Group Overview
overview:
Arieli Group is a global investment firm committed to creating enduring prosperity. We partner with visionary entrepreneurs to transform bold ideas into groundbreaking technologies that shape the future. With a forward-thinking approach, Arieli invests in early and growth-stage companies across industries including cybersecurity, defense, deep tech, healthcare, energy, fintech, and agritech. Rooted in a third-generation family office, Arieli is dedicated to building the next generation of technologies and driving them forward.

Arieli Group’s portfolio includes a controlling stake in leading cybersecurity and B2B software holding company, Elron Ventures; investments in early-stage companies including Velvet, Diamante, Terrific, and others; and joint ventures with the Hebrew University of Jerusalem, Bar Ilan University, Shaare Zedek Medical Center, and others. For more information about Arieli Group, visit us at: www.arieli-group.com.
locations: Ha-Menofim St 10, Herzliya, Israel, King George St 20, Jerusalem, 9426208, Israel, Sea View, החושלים 8, הרצליה, Israel, 40 Wall St, New York, NY 10005, USA, 349 Regents Park Rd, London N3 1DH, UK
industries: Health Tech & Life Sciences, Automotive & Mobility Technologies, Business Software, Other, Fintech & Insurtech

name: Andreessen Horowitz Overview
overview:
Andreessen Horowitz (known as "a16z") is a venture capital firm that backs bold entrepreneurs building the future through technology. Andreessen Horowitz is stage agnostic: investing in seed to late-stage technology companies, across the consumer, enterprise, bio/healthcare, crypto, and fintech spaces.

The firm is led by general partners, many of whom are former founders/operators, CEOs, or CTOs of successful technology companies, and who have domain expertise ranging from biology to crypto to distributed systems to security to marketplaces to financial services.

Andreessen Horowitz aims to connect entrepreneurs, investors, executives, engineers, academics, industry experts, and others in the technology ecosystem. The firm has built a network of experts including technical and executive talent; top media and marketing resources; Fortune 500/Global 2000 companies; as well as other technology decision makers, influencers, and key opinion leaders. a16z uses this network as part of its commitment to help its portfolio companies grow their business, so its operating teams provide entrepreneurs with access to expertise and insights across the entire spectrum of company building.
investment_stages: Early stage, Growth Stage, Late stage
locations: Israel, 2865 Sand Hill Road, Menlo Park, California, USA, 11 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10010, USA, 180 Townsend St, San Francisco, CA 94107, USA
industries: Fintech & Insurtech, Retail Platforms, Business Software, Other, Cyber Security, Health Tech & Life Sciences, Media & Entertainment Technologies
